(2005) | This album = '''''Walking with a Ghost'''''
(2005) | Next album = ''[[Icky Thump]]''
(2007) | Misc = {{Extra musicsample | type = single | filename = Walking With a Ghost (White Stripes).ogg | format = [[Ogg]] | title = "Walking With a Ghost" }} }} '''''Walking with a Ghost''''' is an [[Extended play|EP]] by the American [[alternative rock]] band [[The White Stripes]] and was released in December 2005, six months after ''[[Get Behind Me Satan]]'', on [[V2 Records|V2]]. The cover by [[The White Stripes]] includes a music video. ===Track listing=== All songs by [[Jack White (musician)|Jack White]], except where noted. #"Walking with a Ghost" ([[Sara Quin]]) â 2:47 #"Same Boy You've Always Known" (live) â 3:12 #"As Ugly as I Seem" (live) â 5:04 #"[[The Denial Twist]]" (live) â 2:35 #"Screwdriver" (live) â 5:15 #"Shelter of Your Arms" â 3:30 (extra track on the Japanese edition of the EP) *Tracks three and four recorded live on August 15, 2005 (broadcast September 6, 2005) for Los Angeles' 89.9 [[KCRW]] radio show *Tracks two and five recorded live on June 1, 2005 in [[Manaus]], [[Brazil]]; the latter includes a performance of "Passive Manipulation" *All live tracks also appear as B-sides on singles from the ''[[Get Behind Me Satan]]'' record. ===Personnel=== Only The White Stripes worked on the album. They contributed as follows:[http://www.cduniverse.com/productinfo.asp?pid=6998511&BAB=E Walking with a Ghost] CDUniverse.com Retrieved 2007-11-25 *Jack White - vocals, guitar, piano *Meg White - drums, bongos, percussion ==References== {{Reflist}} {{The White Stripes}} [[Category:2005 EPs]] [[Category:The White Stripes songs]] [[Category:English-language EPs]] [[gl:Walking with a Ghost]] [[it:Walking with a Ghost]] [[pl:Walking With a Ghost]] [[pt:Walking with a Ghost]] [[sh:Walking with a Ghost]] [[fi:Walking with a Ghost]] [[sv:Walking With a Ghost]]
